verses.kjv: Listen, O isles, unto me; and hearken, ye people, from far; The LORD hath called me from the womb; from the bowels of my mother hath he made mention of my name.
verses.ct: Listen to me, you coastlands; pay attention, you distant nations. The LORD called me before I was born; while I was still in my mother's womb, he spoke my name.

verses.kjv: And he hath made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand hath he hid me, and made me a polished shaft; in his quiver hath he hid me;
verses.ct: He made my words as sharp as a sword. He sheltered me in the shadow of his hand. He shaped me into a polished arrow and kept me hidden in his quiver.

verses.kjv: And said unto me, Thou art my servant, O Israel, in whom I will be glorified.
verses.ct: He told me, 'You are my servant, Israel, and through you I will display my glory.'

verses.kjv: Then I said, I have laboured in vain, I have spent my strength for nought, and in vain: yet surely my judgment is with the LORD, and my work with my God.
verses.ct: But I said, 'I have worked for nothing. I used up all my strength and have nothing to show for it.' Still, my case rests with the LORD, and my reward is with my God.

verses.kjv: And now, saith the LORD that formed me from the womb to be his servant, to bring Jacob again to him, Though Israel be not gathered, yet shall I be glorious in the eyes of the LORD, and my God shall be my strength.
verses.ct: Now the LORD speaks — the one who shaped me in the womb to be his servant, to bring Jacob back to him. Even though Israel has not been gathered, I am honored in the LORD's sight, and my God has been my strength.

verses.kjv: And he said, It is a light thing that thou shouldest be my servant to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and to restore the preserved of Israel: I will also give thee for a light to the Gentiles, that thou mayest be my salvation unto the end of the earth.
verses.ct: He said, 'It is too small a task for you to simply be my servant and restore the tribes of Jacob and bring back the survivors of Israel. I will also make you a light to the nations, so that my salvation reaches to the ends of the earth.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the Redeemer of Israel, and his Holy One, to him whom man despiseth, to him whom the nation abhorreth, to a servant of rulers, Kings shall see and arise, princes also shall worship, because of the LORD that is faithful, and the Holy One of Israel, and he shall choose thee.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says — the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One — to the one who is despised by people, detested by the nation, a servant to those in power: 'Kings will see you and stand up. Princes will bow down. This will happen because of the LORD, who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, In an acceptable time have I heard thee, and in a day of salvation have I helped thee: and I will preserve thee, and give thee for a covenant of the people, to establish the earth, to cause to inherit the desolate heritages;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: 'At just the right time I answered you, and on the day of salvation I helped you. I will protect you and make you a covenant for the people, to restore the land and to redistribute the abandoned territories.

verses.kjv: That thou mayest say to the prisoners, Go forth; to them that are in darkness, Shew yourselves. They shall feed in the ways, and their pastures shall be in all high places.
verses.ct: You will say to the prisoners, "Come out!" and to those in darkness, "Show yourselves!" They will graze along every road, and they will find pasture on every barren hill.

verses.kjv: They shall not hunger nor thirst; neither shall the heat nor sun smite them: for he that hath mercy on them shall lead them, even by the springs of water shall he guide them.
verses.ct: They will never be hungry or thirsty. The scorching heat and sun will not beat down on them, because the one who has mercy on them will lead them and guide them to springs of water.

verses.kjv: And I will make all my mountains a way, and my highways shall be exalted.
verses.ct: I will turn all my mountains into roads, and my highways will be raised up.'

verses.kjv: Behold, these shall come from far: and, lo, these from the north and from the west; and these from the land of Sinim.
verses.ct: Look — some will come from far away! Others will arrive from the north and the west, and still others from the land of Sinim.

verses.kjv: Sing, O heavens; and be joyful, O earth; and break forth into singing, O mountains: for the LORD hath comforted his people, and will have mercy upon his afflicted.
verses.ct: Shout for joy, heavens! Celebrate, earth! Burst into song, mountains! For the LORD has comforted his people and will show mercy to his suffering ones.

verses.kjv: But Zion said, The LORD hath forsaken me, and my Lord hath forgotten me.
verses.ct: But Zion said, 'The LORD has abandoned me. My Lord has forgotten me.'

verses.kjv: Can a woman forget her sucking child, that she should not have compassion on the son of her womb? yea, they may forget, yet will I not forget thee.
verses.ct: 'Can a mother forget the baby nursing at her breast? Can she feel no compassion for the child she carried in her womb? Even if she could forget, I will never forget you.

verses.kjv: Behold, I have graven thee upon the palms of my hands; thy walls are continually before me.
verses.ct: Look — I have engraved you on the palms of my hands. Your walls are always in front of me.

verses.kjv: Thy children shall make haste; thy destroyers and they that made thee waste shall go forth of thee.
verses.ct: Your children are hurrying back. Those who destroyed you and left you in ruins will leave you behind.

verses.kjv: Lift up thine eyes round about, and behold: all these gather themselves together, and come to thee. As I live, saith the LORD, thou shalt surely clothe thee with them all, as with an ornament, and bind them on thee, as a bride doeth.
verses.ct: Look around in every direction and see — they are all gathering together and coming to you. As surely as I live,' declares the LORD, 'you will wear them all like jewelry, and fasten them on yourself the way a bride does.'

verses.kjv: For thy waste and thy desolate places, and the land of thy destruction, shall even now be too narrow by reason of the inhabitants, and they that swallowed thee up shall be far away.
verses.ct: 'Your ruined and devastated places, your destroyed land — these will soon be too crowded for all the people living there, and those who consumed you will be far gone.

verses.kjv: The children which thou shalt have, after thou hast lost the other, shall say again in thine ears, The place is too strait for me: give place to me that I may dwell.
verses.ct: The children born during your time of loss will say in your hearing, "This place is too cramped for us. Make room so we can settle here."

verses.kjv: Then shalt thou say in thine heart, Who hath begotten me these, seeing I have lost my children, and am desolate, a captive, and removing to and fro? and who hath brought up these? Behold, I was left alone; these, where had they been?
verses.ct: Then you will ask yourself, "Who gave me all these children? I lost my children and was left desolate, exiled and driven away. So who raised these? I was left all alone — where did all of these come from?"'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, I will lift up mine hand to the Gentiles, and set up my standard to the people: and they shall bring thy sons in their arms, and thy daughters shall be carried upon their shoulders.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: 'Look — I will raise my hand to signal the nations and lift up my banner to the peoples. They will carry your sons in their arms and bring your daughters on their shoulders.

verses.kjv: And kings shall be thy nursing fathers, and their queens thy nursing mothers: they shall bow down to thee with their face toward the earth, and lick up the dust of thy feet; and thou shalt know that I am the LORD: for they shall not be ashamed that wait for me.
verses.ct: Kings will serve as your guardians, and their queens will nurse your children. They will bow down before you with their faces to the ground and lick the dust at your feet. Then you will know that I am the LORD, and those who put their hope in me will never be put to shame.'

verses.kjv: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captive delivered?
verses.ct: Can plunder be snatched away from a warrior? Can captives be rescued from a tyrant?

verses.kjv: But thus saith the LORD, Even the captives of the mighty shall be taken away, and the prey of the terrible shall be delivered: for I will contend with him that contendeth with thee, and I will save thy children.
verses.ct: But this is what the LORD says: 'Yes! Even the captives of the warrior will be taken back, and the plunder of the tyrant will be recovered. I will fight against those who fight against you, and I will rescue your children.

verses.kjv: And I will feed them that oppress thee with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I the LORD am thy Saviour and thy Redeemer, the mighty One of Jacob.
verses.ct: I will make your oppressors consume their own flesh, and they will be drunk on their own blood as if it were wine. Then all of humanity will know that I, the LORD, am your Savior and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.'
